intro: Phebalium obtusifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and leathery, broad leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
